description: A significant 6.2-magnitude earthquake struck northwest Venezuela, causing buildings to shake and prompting evacuations across several states and neighboring Colombia. The quake, with its epicenter near Mene Grande in Zulia state, was felt in major cities like Caracas and Maracaibo.

Trump has repeatedly accused Biden of using the autopen to conceal cognitive decline. This snub is Trump's boldest attempt to criticize Biden, as he reshapes the White House to his preferences.

title: Abhishek Sharma’s sister sends heartwarming message after Asia Cup heroics
description: Abhishek Sharma's impressive 75 propelled India to a 41-run victory over Bangladesh in the Asia Cup Super 4, securing their spot in the final. Despite his run-out denying him a century, his sister Komal remains optimistic, crediting Yuvraj Singh's mentorship. Sharma also broke records, hitting 17 sixes in the tournament.

title: Karnataka HC rejects X plea, backs social media regulation
description: The Karnataka High Court dismissed X Corp's petition against content takedowns, asserting that Indian constitutional law prevails over American free speech standards. The court emphasized the necessity of regulating social media, particularly to protect women's dignity, and stated that foreign corporations cannot claim fundamental rights in India. It upheld the government's Sahyog portal as a legitimate tool for combating cybercrime.

title: Will AI help fix India’s energy demand or will its own needs surge?
description: A McKinsey report has estimated that the annual global demand for data centre capacity could rise at 19-22% from 2023 to 2030, reaching 171-219 GW, against the total current demand of 60 GW. To avoid a deficit, at least twice as much data centre capacity built since 2000 will have to be in place in less than a quarter of the time

description: The Asia Cup is marred by political gestures as Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Mohsin Naqvi endorsed controversial actions, including a fighter-jet gesture, sparking outrage. This follows similar provocations by players like Haris Rauf and Sahibzada Farhan. While Pakistan faces criticism, India's on-field performance, highlighted by Abhishek Sharma and Kuldeep Yadav, secured their spot in the Asia Cup final.

This procurement aims to bolster India's air capabilities amid concerns about regional adversaries and technological advancements.

The prosecution opposed, alleging Makkad prioritized avoiding legal trouble over the victim's wishes.

description: President Trump faced technical issues at the UN headquarters in New York, including a stalled escalator and a malfunctioning teleprompter. The UN stated the escalator stopped due to a safety mechanism possibly triggered by a videographer. Trump joked about the incidents, but US officials are investigating whether the escalator malfunction was intentional.

title: Silicon Valley investor slams H-1B changes: Benefits foreign rivals; misguided
description: Silicon Valley investor Michael Moritz has denounced President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it will stifle innovation and reflects a misunderstanding of the tech sector's success. He argues that companies hire skilled foreign nationals due to labor shortages, not to replace American workers.

title: 'Merely asked a question': US politician defends 'false God' attack on Texas statue
Why Guardians’ David Fry was hospitalized during key Tigers win
description: In a shocking incident, David Fry was injured during a game between the Cleveland Guardians and the Detroit Tigers. A fastball hit Fry in the face. He was immediately taken to the hospital for treatment. The game continued, and the Guardians secured a victory. The team and players expressed their concern for Fry's well-being.

title: Bill Gates credits 15 Indian engineers, says they built Microsoft; viral video
description: Amidst H-1B visa fee hikes and debates, a resurfaced video shows Bill Gates recalling Microsoft's early recruitment of Indian engineers from IITs in the 1980s. Gates emphasizes that this decision was crucial for Microsoft's growth, despite initial criticism about brain drain and concerns over American jobs.

title: Agassi–Graf 2025 net worth: Inside tennis power couple’s fortune
description: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: Nude videos, fraud transactions found in phone: Alwar madrassa cleric held
description: In Alwar's Dholagarh Devi area, 22-year-old cleric Shoaib Khan was apprehended for sextortion and cyber fraud. Police discovered nude videos and fraudulent transactions on his phone, revealing a scheme targeting Bangladeshis through sextortion. Khan, a madarsa teacher, confessed to recording nude videos and extorting victims by threatening to expose them online.

title: Gabrielle Union: ‘No job is worth unease’—on Hollywood’s dark side
description: Popular actress Gabrielle Union revealed how a past sexual assault shaped her Hollywood career. She avoids projects with unsettling individuals, prioritizing her well-being. Union values positive environments over financial gain. Despite past trauma, she achieved success. Her marriage to Dwyane Wade is strong. The couple focuses on family and business ventures. Wade supports Union, and they navigate life together.
